title:
Sharp boundary concentration for a two-dimensional nonlinear Neumann
  problem
authors: Francesca De Marchis, Habib Fourti, Isabella Ianni
abstract:
We consider the elliptic equation $-\Delta u+ u=0$ in a bounded, smooth
domain $\Omega\subset\mathbb R^{2}$ subject to the nonlinear Neumann boundary
condition $\partial u/\partial\nu = |u|^{p-1}u$ on $\partial\Omega$ and study
the asymptotic behavior as the exponent $p\rightarrow +\infty$ of families of
positive solutions $u_p$ satisfying uniform energy bounds. We prove energy
quantization and characterize the boundary concentration. In particular we
describe the local asymptotic profile of the solutions around each
concentration point and get sharp convergence results for the
$L^{\infty}$-norm.
